name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: The Wyoming Department of Health has asked all COVID-19 vaccine providers to temporarily pause the administration of Johnson & Johnson (Janssen) vaccines until further federal guidance is issued.

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: COVID-19 vaccinations are now available to all Wyoming residents ages 16 and older. Vaccination is free and no insurance is required. Find your county information here:  https://t.co/KmsQNp2xQO

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: I have issued proclamations declaring Dec. 16 COVID-19 Pandemic Heroes Day and Dec. 18 as Military Health Care Worker Day.  We dedicate these days to the heroes among us in across the state.  https://t.co/VjKMRcgwBx

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: In these challenging times, it’s critical that our citizens receive accurate information. The role of the @wyoguard is to assist with contact tracing for COVID-19. It does not include any enforcement activities whatsoever.  https://t.co/v5spIBYtXi

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: We know case numbers are surging in Wyoming and COVID-19 hospitalizations are more than double what they were 2 weeks ago. Social distance when possible, wear a mask when you can’t, and practice good hygiene. Our economy is open and we want to keep it that way.

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: Today we announced that free, at-home COVID-19 testing is now available to all Wyoming residents. This saliva test, currently in use at UW, is another tool to help us slow the spread of the virus. More information is available here:  https://t.co/seruCDJUlF

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: I will be holding a media briefing at 3 pm today. I will discuss the budget cuts we have implemented to address Wyoming's revenue shortfall and provide a COVID-19 update. Watch live on Facebook @WyomingPBS TV and YouTube.  https://t.co/1yJ2enAhre

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: I have established a grant program using CARES Act funds to pay for higher education for adults who are unemployed or underemployed due to the impacts of COVID-19. We want to support Wyoming workers seeking to obtain new skills and advance their careers.  https://t.co/BcBU7Wd1T6

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: Wyoming businesses and nonprofits can now apply for the Relief and Mitigation Funds from our COVID-19 Business Relief Program. Learn more and apply at  https://t.co/heIkCO6hsT  https://t.co/5QkauMv2RN

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: I will hold a media briefing at 3 p.m. today, July 28, to provide an update on the COVID-19 pandemic and the deployment of CARES Act funding to address the pandemic's impacts. Watch live on @WyomingPBS TV, Facebook, and the Wyoming PBS YouTube channel.  https://t.co/nSV35JyIel

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: Teton County has seen a surge of COVID-19 cases recently that has led to the shuttering of multiple businesses. We continue to work with all counties and respect the requests that are made based on local conditions. 2/3

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: We've made available a free mobile app to help reduce the spread of COVID-19.  Participation is voluntary, your privacy is protected, and the location data can help enhance our contact tracing efforts. Learn more and download here:  https://t.co/YnuCEJDzGe  https://t.co/sNyp4fwGob

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: Assistance remains available for Wyoming residents who lack sufficient income or resources to pay housing costs due to COVID-19. The Wyoming Emergency Housing Assistance Program is still accepting applications. To apply visit  https://t.co/ckym2U9XTq

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: Given the increase in the number of cases of COVID-19 we have seen in recent weeks, Wyoming has extended the public health orders currently in place through July 15. We've seen 288 new cases of COVID-19 in 15 counties in the past 2 weeks. 1/3

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: I'm holding a media briefing at 4pm today, June 16, to provide a COVID-19 update. Watch live on @WyomingPBS Facebook or YouTube.  https://t.co/S23z7DCCXe

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: It is my hope and desire that we do not see additional infections and cases of COVID-19 in Wyoming due to the recent protests. Wyoming will carefully monitor the rate of infection over the next few weeks. We have made outstanding progress and I remain hopeful...4/5

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: Our COVID-19 dashboard has been updated to reflect the improvement in the statewide metrics used to ease restrictions. It is important to remain vigilant, but with our continued success, I am confident we can continue lifting the very few remaining public health restrictions. 2/2  https://t.co/osVMRenj6z

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: I will hold a media briefing at 3 pm today, June 4, to provide updates on COVID-19 and the state's budget. Watch live on @WyomingPBS TV, Facebook and here:  https://t.co/w5Xg0zdyM0

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: I'm holding a media briefing at 3 pm today, May 27, to provide a COVID-19 update and discuss the status of large events in Wyoming this summer. Watch live on @WyomingPBS television, Facebook and YouTube.  https://t.co/poFCOfWPo4

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: Under our new plan, WY will conduct COVID-19 testing at long-term care facilities. We will be test a % of all residents & staff at each facility; Where there is a confirmed case, all staff & residents will be tested weekly. Early interventions are critical to limiting outbreaks.

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: Staying safe during COVID-19 shouldn't mean sacrificing the health of your children. Well child visits are still critical, and healthcare providers have adapted to ensure patient safety.  https://t.co/imFPzEENpN

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: We have also developed an eviction prevention program for eligible renters and homeowners who have been financially impacted by COVID-19. It will be administered by the Wyoming Community Development Authority which will begin accepting applications soon. 3/4

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: Yesterday I signed three bills that provide a framework for spending the $1.25 billion in federal funding Wyoming received through the CARES Act. These bills will help Wyoming expand COVID-19 testing, fund economic development projects.... 1/4  https://t.co/YuwffhYLni

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: I'm holding a briefing at 3pm today, May 20, to provide an update on COVID-19 in Wyoming and talk about the 3 bills passed by the Legislature during the recent special session. Watch online at @WyomingPBS TV, Facebook and Youtube.  https://t.co/yifEiFafi3

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: The recent death of a member of the Northern Arapaho tribe and the two additional deaths recently identified are sad reminders of the serious, ongoing impact of COVID-19. My thoughts are with their. families. We must continue our efforts to minimize the spread of this virus.

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: Looking for more data about COVID-19 in your county? The Health Department has county-specific dashboards to help you better understand what's happening with the virus where you live. Visit  https://t.co/d2TuEk8hVi  https://t.co/MQ7QGTnZzZ

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: Face coverings can help slow the spread of COVID-19 and help prevent those who may not know they have the virus from transmitting it to others. I encourage everyone to wear one when social distancing is not possible. It's a courtesy to protect your neighbors and your community.  https://t.co/gqp9ttb8Ws

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: I will be holding a media briefing at 3 pm today, May 13 to discuss updated public health orders, COVID-19 testing and the special session. I will be joined by @EdBuchananWyo who will provide an update on the 2020 election season. Watch live on @WyomingPBS Youtube and Facebook.  https://t.co/FZfZ0A2dnX

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: The @CDCgov conducted a special testing study of 46 patients and 172 staff members at the Wyoming State Hospital in Evanston and found no new cases of COVID-19. Kudos to our WSH hospital staff for their vigilance.  https://t.co/wRrX9qYmme

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: We reported 8 new cases of COVID-19 today. Nearly two-thirds of the state's confirmed cases have fully recovered. The 14-day self-quarantine directive will now expire on May 8 and camping at State Parks campgrounds will begin to open on May 15 for Wyoming residents only.  https://t.co/Vu9qthPX0d

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: We saw a spike in confirmed cases today in Fremont County. With additional supplies, the state's public health lab has expanded testing. Remember to wear a mask for the protection of others– COVID-19 can be transmitted even when you are not showing symptoms.  https://t.co/2laoRYluys

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: I will be holding a media briefing at 3 pm today, April 23, to discuss the state's response to COVID-19 and plans going forward. Watch live on @WyomingPBS Facebook, YouTube and television.  https://t.co/QrsBZuii9X

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: I joined @TeamCavuto today on @FoxNews to talk about the plunge in oil prices and Wyoming’s COVID-19 response.  https://t.co/e3hiXLBO4G

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: 3/3 I continue to communicate regularly with Tribal leadership regarding both State and tribal strategies for handling the mounting challenges posed by COVID-19.  The Tribes and State must coordinate our response for the health of Wyoming citizens, as we are all in this together.

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: 1/3 I want to extend my condolences to the Northern Arapaho Tribe and to the families of the four individuals that passed away last night due to COVID-19. These deaths highlight the insidious nature of the illness,

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: We all want our businesses and workers to be able to thrive again. But, we must be deliberate about our process. COVID-19 can spread easily, even among people without symptoms. We are working on a plan to transition Wyoming, but social distancing must continue. #SlowTheSpread  https://t.co/YBCc2OKmUR

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: Our rural hospitals are critical to Wyoming communities and our state's economy. COVID-19 has put them under additional stress.

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: Limiting outings is important. The more places you go, the greater opportunity there is for COVID-19 to spread. When you have to go out, only do so for essentials. #SlowTheSpread  https://t.co/URlHW4M7Es

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: Today we learned of the 2nd COVID-19 related death in Wyoming. As of today, there are 19 reported hospitalizations statewide for COVID-19. As we consider our steps moving forward, we will continue to use data to inform our decisions. #StayHomeStaySafe  https://t.co/oITey3BxWU

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: I'll be holding a media briefing at 4 p.m. today, April 15 to provide an update on Wyoming’s ongoing response to the COVID-19 pandemic. It can be viewed live on Wyoming PBS TV, their Facebook page and YouTube channel.  https://t.co/UuGP5YISe7

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: Wyoming's first death related to COVID-19 was reported today along with 5 new cases. We must continue to be vigilant about following public health guidance and social distancing, particularly because this disease is so dangerous to those who are most vulnerable. #StaySafeStayHome  https://t.co/KFhBIxsTSO

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: I am saddened to learn that we have lost our first Wyoming citizen to COVID-19, a Johnson County man with underlying health conditions that put him at higher risk of severe illness and complications related to the virus.  This one was close to home... 1/2

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: We have confirmed 70 new cases of COVID-19 in Wyoming in the past 7 days, and there are now confirmed cases in all but two Wyoming counties. Remember, the "recovered" number in parenthesis on this map includes probable cases that have recovered. More data:  https://t.co/6Tl2r9yc1v  https://t.co/Vs9EQDosC1

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: Teton and Laramie counties continue to have the largest number of confirmed COVID-19 cases. Stay safe tomorrow—a spring snowstorm should make it easy to choose to stay home and celebrate with family. Wyoming, your efforts are making a difference. Thank you.  https://t.co/7Yl16yAShy

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: I have signed a proclamation declaring today a Day of Prayer in Response to the COVID-19 Pandemic. Across all faiths and beliefs, we can all come together at this time of year to find a sense of peace and purpose. #DayOfPrayer #StayHomeStaySafe  https://t.co/dttSAcwkHm

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: As more test results return, we are learning more about how COVID-19 is spreading in Wyoming. We may have fewer confirmed cases than other states, but the illness caused by this virus is serious. A few cases in a small community can cause devastating impacts. #StayHomeStaySafe  https://t.co/tQr37poRiB

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: We have added data on Probable Cases. These include a total count of people who are a close contact to a laboratory confirmed COVID-19  case AND develop symptoms, but are not tested. This count includes probable cases that have recovered. More data here:  https://t.co/6Tl2r9gB9X  https://t.co/2L4rM0IjWp

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: I'm holding a media briefing at 1 p.m. today, April 8, to provide updates on COVID-19 in Wyoming and the resources available to help workers and businesses. You can watch live on my Facebook page, Wyoming PBS television and  https://t.co/XsLydK0F6g.

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: We have now added recovered cases in each county along with the total number of confirmed positive cases.  For those seeking more information, additional data is available on the Wyoming Health Department's COVID-19 webpage. #StayHomeStaySafe  https://t.co/qmhdA5o7rh

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: We will be adding additional information to this overview in the near future. Remember that testing supplies remain limited and this is not a complete picture of the presence of COVID-19 statewide. #StayHomeStaySafe   https://t.co/6Tl2r9yc1v  https://t.co/2Cd8bTZOhn

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: The Wyoming Department of Health is supporting a CDC recommendation to wear cloth face coverings if you need to go out in the community in order to help slow the spread of COVID-19. This is not a replacement for social distancing. Guidelines here:  https://t.co/xjexhwMh35

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: Wyoming recorded it's 200th confirmed case of COVID-19 today, but we know that there are many more untested Wyomingites who have the virus. Keep yourself and your family safe and our healthcare workers protected by staying home and social distancing. #StayHomeStayHealthy  https://t.co/Ubl9IBo9hp

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: I have extended the three existing statewide health orders through April 30 to slow community transmission of COVID-19. I want to be perfectly clear- we want all Wyoming residents to stay at home. Our focus is on improving compliance and adherence. That is how we will save lives.

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: At 3 p.m. today, April 3, I am holding a press conference to provide an update on Wyoming's response to COVID-19 and outline what we are doing next to keep Wyomingites safe. You can watch here on Facebook or on Youtube at  https://t.co/5QQODg9sNb.  https://t.co/H7nbDNT9yP

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: We continue to monitor the spread of COVID-19 closely and now have confirmed cases in 16 Wyoming counties as well as additional recovered cases. By staying home and avoiding gatherings, we can #SlowTheSpread and save lives.  https://t.co/vZ2BTruhfF

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: Please note, the number of tests does not include all negative results from private laboratories. COVID-19 will continue to spread and doesn't discriminate according to age or overall health. But we know staying home and social distancing will help #SlowTheSpread  https://t.co/ALqFAY0fkY

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: ▶️We have updated info on  https://t.co/eRcuaJGPqQ including an FAQ for Wyoming citizens and additional links to resources developed from our 5 COVID-19 task forces. #StayHome

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: Additional collection kits were distributed last week, but testing is still limited nationally and in Wyoming. It's important for Wyomingites to understand this is not a complete picture of the prevalence of COVID-19 in our state. Stay safe, stay home, practice #SocialDistancing  https://t.co/bvu5ebqAwI

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: I am extending the three statewide health orders through April 17 to #slowthespread of community transmission of COVID-19. It is imperative we all respond to this public health crisis by staying home whenever possible and practicing proper social distancing when they must go out.

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: The number of counties with confirmed cases has increased, a reminder that COVID-19 will impact all of us. Staying home whenever possible is the best way to #SlowTheSpread We have added data on recovered cases to this graphic.  https://t.co/sPkHPxF2Sz

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: I urge our citizens to stay home whenever possible and go out only when absolutely necessary. This will help Wyoming #SlowtheSpread of COVID-19 and #FlattenTheCurve Your voluntary actions and discipline will make the difference for you, your family and your neighbors. #COVID19WY  https://t.co/hfAAD7JBb6

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: I understand the impact of these measures and sympathize with those most affected, especially small business owners, but this is about saving lives. We have tried to navigate a thoughtful course, but as COVID-19 spreads through our communities, we must take this action now.

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: We have confirmed two additional cases of COVID-19 in the state today. Viruses don't respect county boundaries- the best way to #SlowTheSpread is staying home whenever possible, working from home if it's feasible and limiting our trips out. #COVID19WY  https://t.co/12R0Ud38XC

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: 6/9 ...the enormity of the public health challenge facing us and respond to it. COVID-19 may seem far away, but it is here. Our neighboring states are all experiencing the same escalation in the number of positive cases as we are.

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: Excellent news: Wyoming small businesses impacted by COVID-19 have received final Federal approval to seek loans up to $2 million as part of the SBA’s Economic Injury Disaster Loan program. To apply visit:  https://t.co/o5lyRxovgZ #COVID19WY

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: The First Lady will be joining me for a Facebook Live broadcast at 6:30 pm tonight, March 19, to discuss COVID-19 and its impact to our state. Please join us.

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: I have endorsed an order from our state health officer closing public places for a period of 2 weeks to help slow the spread of COVID-19. It is a critical step for protecting public health and the health of our most vulnerable residents.  https://t.co/Z8617fwG3Y

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: It's time for Wyomingites to do all we can to slow the spread of COVID-19 in the state. Following the @POTUS social distancing guidelines will benefit all of us, particularly our health care providers and vulnerable populations. #covid19WY  https://t.co/77dCaZl4OT

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: We've launched a state website to provide resources and information on the COVID-19 pandemic,  https://t.co/eRcuaJGPqQ Do your part to mitigate the impacts. #COVID19WY  https://t.co/bpUVrWzaYR

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: 1/4 Today, in consultation with our State Health Officer, I am supporting the #coronavirus  Guidelines President Trump has issued for America. Accordingly, over the next 15 days, I ask that we do all we can as Wyomingites to help slow the spread of COVID-19 in our state.  https://t.co/Sv04RzVkr3

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: Visit  https://t.co/2LyxYPFET7 and click on the COVID-19 tab in the upper left for information and links related to the COVID-19 outbreak. We expect to issue additional recommendations from our office later today.

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: I will host a press conference at 3:30 today to provide an update on Wyoming’s planning and response to the COVID-19 pandemic. It will be streamed on my Facebook page:  https://t.co/zDNe08RsV1

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: This is an attempt to allow schools and communities to prepare to operate in a way that mitigates community spread of COVID-19 and minimizes negative economic impacts locally and statewide.

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: Wyoming has confirmed the second known case of COVID-19 in the state. The patient is a hospitalized older adult male Fremont County resident with currently unknown exposure risk. We will be sharing additional information as it becomes available.  https://t.co/TuYxEiSCZS

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: I will be hosting a press conference on the states response to the first COVID-19 case. It will be streamed on my Facebook page.

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: Our state health lab has identified the first known case of a state resident with coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19). The individual is an adult female from Sheridan County with some recent domestic travel history.

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: Older adults and those with underlying chronic illnesses are most at risk of severe COVID-19 illness. Wyoming is continuing to prepare and working to protect public health in the event cases appear within our state. For more information, visit  https://t.co/phCWwiLBt5

name: Governor Mark Gordon
tweet: Earlier today I joined the nations governors and @VP for a weekly phone call to hear the latest updates from the @CDCgov . While Wyoming still has no confirmed cases of COVID-19 it’s likely the disease will spread to our state at some point. We are preparing for that likelihood.
